Sentencas: This paper report the results of our investigation on electrophoretic deposition (EPD) of YSZ particles from its suspension in acetylacetone onto a non-conducting NiO-YSZ substrate.
Titulo: Electrophoretic deposition on non-conducting substrates: The case of YSZ film on NiO-YSZ composite substrates for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: In principle, it is not possible to carry out electrophoretic deposition on non-conducting substrates.
Titulo: Electrophoretic deposition on non-conducting substrates: The case of YSZ film on NiO-YSZ composite substrates for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: In this case, the EPD of YSZ particles on a NiO-YSZ substrate was made possible through the use of an adequately porous substrate.
Titulo: Electrophoretic deposition on non-conducting substrates: The case of YSZ film on NiO-YSZ composite substrates for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: The continuous pores in the substrates, when saturated with the solvent, helped in establishing a conductive path between the electrode and the particles in suspension.
Titulo: Electrophoretic deposition on non-conducting substrates: The case of YSZ film on NiO-YSZ composite substrates for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: Deposition rate was found to increase with increasing substrate porosity up to a certain value.
Titulo: Electrophoretic deposition on non-conducting substrates: The case of YSZ film on NiO-YSZ composite substrates for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: The higher the applied voltage, the faster the deposition.
Titulo: Electrophoretic deposition on non-conducting substrates: The case of YSZ film on NiO-YSZ composite substrates for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: For a given applied voltage, there exists a threshold porosity value below which EPD becomes practically impossible.
Titulo: Electrophoretic deposition on non-conducting substrates: The case of YSZ film on NiO-YSZ composite substrates for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: An SOFC constructed on bi-layers of NiO-YSZ/YSZ with YSZ layer thickness of 40 mu m exhibited an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 0.97 V at 650 degrees C and peak power density of 263.8 mW cm(-2) at 850 degrees C when tested with H-2 as fuel and ambient air as oxidant.
Titulo: Electrophoretic deposition on non-conducting substrates: The case of YSZ film on NiO-YSZ composite substrates for solid oxide fuel cell application
Electrophoretic deposition on non-conducting substrates: The case of YSZ film on NiO-YSZ composite substrates for solid oxide fuel cell application
